channel.title: Uploader on OpenAerialMap Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Uploader on OpenAerialMap Docs

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: OpenAerialMap Uploader The OAM imagery database is made up of the contributions of users. Learn more about how to upload. The OAM uploader consists of two different tools: the upload form and the server to glue everything together

item.title: Api Server
Uploader Form
item.description: The upload form is the way for users to contribute to the OAM imagery database. Besides uploading the imagery itself, contributors need to provide metadata for imagery datasets. There are two types of fields for filling in the metadata: fields for input values (Title, Sensor, Provider, Tags, Contact info) and fields with choices (Platform, Date start, Date end, Contact, License). Also, there is an opportunity to upload several imagery datasets by clicking on the “New dataset” button.
